title: HTML spec change: escaping < and > in attributes
description: What you need to know about this change to how attributes are escaped.

title: A new way to style gaps in CSS
description: Say goodbye to border and pseudo-element hacks.

title: Easy way to upload, transform and deliver files and images (Sponsored)
description: Managing media is a really difficult task if you try to do all of it yourself, especially if the media comes from other sources. The file can be submitted in any state and size, but what if you need something really specific? You can code it all yourself or you can use an awesome service […] The post Easy way to upload, transform and deliver files and images (Sponsored) appeared first on David Walsh Blog.
author: David Walsh

title: How to Download a YouTube Video or Channel
description: The ability to download media on the internet almost feels like a lost art. When I was in my teens, piracy of mp3s, movies, and just about everything else via torrents and apps like Kazaa, LimeWire, Napster, etc. was in full swing. These days sites use blob URLs and other means to prevent downloads. Luckily […] The post How to Download a YouTube Video or Channel appeared first on David Walsh Blog.
author: David Walsh

title: Breaking Boundaries: Building a Tangram Puzzle With (S)CSS
description: We put it to the test and it turns out Sass can replace JavaScript, at least when it comes to low-level logic and puzzle behavior. With nothing but maps, mixins, functions, and a whole lot of math, we managed to bring our Tangram puzzle to life, no JavaScript required. Breaking Boundaries: Building a Tangram Puzzle With (S)CSS originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
author: Sladjana Stojanovic

title: Creating an Auto-Closing Notification With an HTML Popover
description: The HTML popover attribute transforms elements into top-layer elements that can be opened and closed with a button or JavaScript. Popovers can be dismissed a number of ways, but there is no option to auto-close them. Preethi has a technique you can use. Creating an Auto-Closing Notification With an HTML Popover originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.
author: Preethi
